Overview # RUBot is a Telegram bot built with NestJS that delivers the daily and weekly menu of UFPA‚Äôs university restaurant. It scrapes the official RU website, formats the menu, and sends it through a user-friendly Telegram interface.
The project also includes a RESTful API for retrieving menus in JSON format (currently private).
carloscardoso05/rubjs HTML 0 0 Features # Photo by Jr Korpa on Unsplash Telegram Bot # Built with Telegraf and nestjs-telegraf for seamless Telegram API integration. Commands: /hoje ‚Üí Returns today‚Äôs menu. /semana ‚Üí Returns the menu for the entire week. Web Scraping # Uses Cheerio to extract daily and weekly menus directly from UFPA‚Äôs RU website. Automatically formats meals with icons highlighting the main dish, vegetarian option, and side dishes. REST API # Provides endpoints for programmatic access to menus: /hoje ‚Üí Today‚Äôs menu in JSON format. /semana ‚Üí Weekly menu in JSON format. Security & Reliability # Prevents abuse with rate limiting using telegraf-ratelimit. Includes basic error handling for scraping failures. Tech Stack # Programming Language: TypeScript Backend Framework: NestJS Scraping: Cheerio Messaging: Telegraf, nestjs-telegraf Tools: ESLint + Prettier (linting and formatting) Jest (unit and e2e testing) dotenv (environment configuration) Project Structure # src/scraper/ ‚Üí Extracts menus from the RU website. src/formatter/ ‚Üí Formats scraped data into readable messages for Telegram. src/bot/ ‚Üí Handles Telegram commands and bot interactions. src/app.controller.ts ‚Üí REST API endpoints for menus. Installation & Running # Prerequisites # Node.js 18+ and npm installed. Telegram bot token (create one via Telegram Bot Tutorial). Setup # Create a .env file in the project root: TELEGRAM_KEY=<your_bot_token> Install dependencies: npm install Run in development mode: npm run start:dev Run in production: npm run start:prod Testing # npm run test Contributing # Contributions, issues, and feature requests are welcome!
